fibre_switch module¶

exception fibre_switch.FiberSwitchHWError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Thrown after a hardware instruction is exectued, if a discrepancy is detected

exception fibre_switch.FiberSwitchLogicError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Thrown on inconsistencies noticed before any directions to the hardware

class fibre_switch.FibreSwitch[source]¶

Bases: object

Controlles the fibre switch via commands sent down a serial port. Port and baud rate are set in config.py

execute_message(msg)[source]¶

Send a command message over the serial port, followed by \r\n to exectute (so you do not need to add this)

Parameters:msg (string) –
get_channel()[source]¶

Poll the hardware for the current channel

Returns:current channel
get_fwr_version()[source]¶

Get the current fwr version as a string

read_back()[source]¶

Wait a configuration determined time, and read back a line from the HW

Returns:message
set_channel(channel_num)[source]¶

Set the fibre switch channel, and check that it suceeded

Parameters:channel_num – requested new channel
Raises:FiberSwitchLogicError: if the channel is unphysical
Raises:FiberSwitchHWError if the command is unsucessful
set_io_channels(in_channel, out_channel)[source]¶

Set the channel number using an input and output channel

Parameters:
  • in_channel – Input
  • out_channel – Output
Raises:

FiberSwitchLogicError if channel is unphysical
Raises:

FiberSwitchHWError if the command is unsucessful
fibre_switch.check_channel(channel_num)[source]¶

Fibre switch is limited to 70 channels input = [1, 5], output = [1, 14]

Parameters:channel_num – The channel number to check
Raises:FiberSwitchLogicError if the channel is unphysical
fibre_switch.global_channel_number(in_chan, out_chan)[source]¶

Convert an (input channel, output channel) to a global channelID
